headline: United Airlines (UAL) Margin Expansion Reinforces Bullish Narrative Despite Modest Growth Outlook
summary: United Airlines Holdings (UAL) reported net profit margins of 5.6%, up from last year’s 4.9%, and delivered 19.2% earnings growth over the past year, although this trailed its robust 5-year average growth of 69.1% per year. Shares currently trade at $98.19, notably above the estimated fair value of $71.72, while the Price-to-Earnings ratio stands at 9.7x, below peers at 21.1x and just under the global airline industry average of 9.9x. Investors are weighing improved margins and steady...

headline: UAL Q3 Deep Dive: Premium Demand, Cost Efficiency, and Loyalty Program Shape Outlook
summary: Airline company United Airlines Holdings (NASDAQ:UAL) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.6% year on year to $15.23 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.78 per share was 3.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: UAL Q3 Deep Dive: Premium Demand, Cost Efficiency, and Loyalty Program Shape Outlook
content.summary: Airline company United Airlines Holdings (NASDAQ:UAL) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.6% year on year to $15.23 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.78 per share was 3.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: TSMC stock under some pressure, American Battery plunges
summary: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM) raising its full-year revenue outlook for 2025, United Airlines (UAL) stock under pressure amid operational issues at the Newark Liberty International Airport, and American Battery Technology (ABAT) shares plummeting after the US government canceled grant funding. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: United Stock, Other Airline Shares Turn Lower
summary: United Airlines shares were about 5% lower, at one point falling more than 7% as investors digested earnings from yesterday afternoon. The Chicago-based carrier said revenue rose 2.6% to $15.2 billion, landing below analyst projections for $15.

content.title: United Stock, Other Airline Shares Turn Lower
content.summary: United Airlines shares were about 5% lower, at one point falling more than 7% as investors digested earnings from yesterday afternoon. The Chicago-based carrier said revenue rose 2.6% to $15.2 billion, landing below analyst projections for $15.

summary: Shares of airline company United Airlines Holdings (NASDAQ:UAL) fell 9.4% in the afternoon session after the company reported mixed third-quarter results that showed signs of rising cost pressures, overshadowing a strong earnings forecast.

headline: Does United Airlines’ Recent 44% Rally Offer Opportunity After FAA Flight Delays?
summary: If you have been eyeing United Airlines Holdings stock, you are definitely not alone. Every investor, whether seasoned or new to the skies, faces the classic question: “Is now the right time to buckle in or is turbulence ahead?” Over the last year, United’s share price has shot up an impressive 44.5%, with a jaw-dropping 192.8% surge over five years. Those numbers hint at plenty of passengers hopping on board, especially as travel demand continues to bounce back. Of course, it has not all...

headline: United Airlines Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Stock Is Dropping.
summary: United Airlines’ shares fell Thursday after the carrier beat expectations for third-quarter earnings and offered a better-than-expected outlook but third-quarter revenue fell shy of expectations.  United reported third-quarter adjusted earnings of $2.78 a share, beating its own guidance.  Revenue of $15.23 billion was 2.6% higher than $14.84 billion in the third quarter of 2024, but missed expectations for $15.33 billion.

content.title: United Airlines Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Stock Is Dropping.
content.summary: United Airlines’ shares fell Thursday after the carrier beat expectations for third-quarter earnings and offered a better-than-expected outlook but third-quarter revenue fell shy of expectations.  United reported third-quarter adjusted earnings of $2.78 a share, beating its own guidance.  Revenue of $15.23 billion was 2.6% higher than $14.84 billion in the third quarter of 2024, but missed expectations for $15.33 billion.

headline: United added too much capacity last quarter: Analyst on earnings
summary: United Airlines (UAL) stock is experiencing some turbulence this morning after releasing mixed third quarter results on Wednesday, the airline operator beating adjusted earnings estimates ($2.78 per share vs. estimates of $2.66) while falling just short of revenue expectations ($15.2 billion vs. estimates of $15.28 billion) Bloomberg Intelligence senior aerospace defense and airlines industry analyst George Ferguson compares the boost in premium air travel that United has seen with the operator's own capacities. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Bloomberg Intelligence senior aerospace defense and airlines industry analyst George Ferguson compares the boost in premium air travel that United has seen with the operator's own capacities.

headline: TSMC profit, Trump on oil, United Airlines earnings: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rising Thursday morning, lifted by the AI trade and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company's (TSM) strong third quarter earnings results. Oil (CL=F, BZ=F) edges higher after President Trump has stated that India has promised to stop importing Russian oil. Indian officials have yet to confirm this. United Airlines (UAL) shares appear under some pressure today after beating earnings estimates but falling just short of revenue expectations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: UATP Partners with Burbank to Deliver Card-Present over Internet® Solutions to Airline Merchants
summary: UATP, the global network enabling organizations to simplify payment processes and expand their payment capabilities, today announced a strategic partnership with Burbank, a pioneer in next-generation payments technology behind the world's first Card-Present over Internet (CPoI®) technology. Through this partnership, UATP will offer the CPoI® solution to airline merchants to securely process card-present transactions in online channels.

content.title: UATP Partners with Burbank to Deliver Card-Present over Internet® Solutions to Airline Merchants
content.summary: UATP, the global network enabling organizations to simplify payment processes and expand their payment capabilities, today announced a strategic partnership with Burbank, a pioneer in next-generation payments technology behind the world's first Card-Present over Internet (CPoI®) technology. Through this partnership, UATP will offer the CPoI® solution to airline merchants to securely process card-present transactions in online channels.

thumbnail.caption: UATP is a global payment solution owned and operated by the world's airlines and accepted by thousands of merchants for air, rail and travel agency payments. UATP connects airlines to Alternative Forms of Payment which can expand reach and generate incremental sales globally. UATP offers easy-to-use data tools, DataStream(SM) and DataMine(SM), which provide comprehensive account details to Issuers and Corporate Subscribers for accurate travel management. UATP is accepted as a form of payment for corporate business travel worldwide by airlines, travel agencies and Amtrak; UATP accounts are issued by: Aeromexico, APG Airlines, Air Canada, Air New Zealand, Air Niugini, American Airlines, Austrian Airlines, China Eastern Airlines, Delta Air Lines, EL AL Israel Airlines, Etihad Airways, Frontier Airlines, GOL Linhas aereas inteligentes S.A., Hahn Air; Japan Airlines, Malaysia Airlines, Qantas Airways, Shandong Airlines, Transavia Airlines, TUIfly GmbH, Turkish Airline, United Airlines, and WestJet. AirPlus International issues the UATP-based Company Account for: British Airways and Lufthansa German Airlines. (PRNewsFoto/Universal Air Travel Plan, Inc.)
